From prototype to production. Get an API key All your sessions can be viewed on the AgentOps dashboard <br/> Self-Hosting Looking to run the full AgentOps app Dashboard + API backend on your machine? Follow the setup guide in : - Run the App and Backend Dashboard + API <details> <summary>Agent Debugging</summary> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/session-drilldown-metadata.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Agent Metadata"/> </a> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/chat-viewer.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Chat Viewer"/> </a> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/session-drilldown-graphs.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Event Graphs"/> </a> </details> <details> <summary>Session Replays</summary> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/session-replay.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Session Replays"/> </a> </details> <details> <summary>Summary Analytics</summary> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/overview.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Summary Analytics"/> </a> <a href="https://app.agentops.ai?ref=gh"> <img src="docs/images/external/appscreenshots/overview-charts.png" style="width: 90%;" alt="Summary Analytics Charts"/> </a> </details> First class Developer Experience Add powerful observability to your agents, tools, and functions with as little code as possible: one line at a time. <br/> Refer to our documentation All decorators support: - Input/Output Recording - Exception Handling - Async/await functions - Generator functions - Custom attributes and names Integrations ğŸ¦¾ OpenAI Agents SDK ğŸ–‡ï¸ Build multi-agent systems with tools, handoffs, and guardrails. AgentOps natively integrates with the OpenAI Agents SDKs for both Python and TypeScript. Python - Python integration guide - OpenAI Agents Python documentation TypeScript - TypeScript integration guide - OpenAI Agents JS documentation CrewAI ğŸ›¶ Build Crew agents with observability in just 2 lines of code. Simply set an in your environment, and your crews will get automatic monitoring on the AgentOps dashboard. - AgentOps integration example - Official CrewAI documentation AG2 ğŸ¤– With only two lines of code, add full observability and monitoring to AG2 formerly AutoGen agents. Set an in your environment and call - AG2 Observability Example - AG2 - AgentOps Documentation Camel AI ğŸª Track and analyze CAMEL agents with full observability. Set an in your environment and initialize AgentOps to get started. - Camel AI - Advanced agent communication framework - AgentOps integration example - Official Camel AI documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> Check out our Camel integration guide for more examples including multi-agent scenarios. </details> Langchain ğŸ¦œğŸ”— AgentOps works seamlessly with applications built using Langchain. To use the handler, install Langchain as an optional dependency: <details> <summary>Installation</summary> To use the handler, import and set Check out the Langchain Examples Notebook for more details including Async handlers. </details> Cohere âŒ¨ï¸ First class support for Cohere>=5.4.0. This is a living integration, should you need any added functionality please message us on Discord! - AgentOps integration example - Official Cohere documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> </details> Anthropic ï¹¨ Track agents built with the Anthropic Python SDK >=0.32.0. - AgentOps integration guide - Official Anthropic documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> Streaming Async </details> Mistral ã€½ï¸ Track agents built with the Mistral Python SDK >=0.32.0. - AgentOps integration example - Official Mistral documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> Sync Streaming Async Async Streaming </details> CamelAI ï¹¨ Track agents built with the CamelAI Python SDK >=0.32.0. - CamelAI integration guide - Official CamelAI documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> </details> You can find usage examples here!. LiteLLM ğŸš… AgentOps provides support for LiteLLM>=1.3.1, allowing you to call 100+ LLMs using the same Input/Output Format. - AgentOps integration example - Official LiteLLM documentation <details> <summary>Installation</summary> </details> LlamaIndex ğŸ¦™ AgentOps works seamlessly with applications built using LlamaIndex, a framework for building context-augmented generative AI applications with LLMs. <details> <summary>Installation</summary> To use the handler, import and set Check out the LlamaIndex docs for more details. </details> Llama Stack ğŸ¦™ğŸ¥ AgentOps provides support for Llama Stack Python Client>=0.0.53, allowing you to monitor your Agentic applications. - AgentOps integration example 1 - AgentOps integration example 2 - Official Llama Stack Python Client SwarmZero AI ğŸ Track and analyze SwarmZero agents with full observability. Set an in your environment and initialize AgentOps to get started. - SwarmZero - Advanced multi-agent framework - AgentOps integration example - SwarmZero AI integration example - SwarmZero AI - AgentOps documentation - Official SwarmZero Python SDK <details> <summary>Installation</summary> </details> Evaluations Roadmap ğŸ§­ | Platform | Dashboard | Evals | | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------- | | âœ… Python SDK | âœ… Multi-session and Cross-session metrics | âœ… Custom eval metrics | | ğŸš§ Evaluation builder API | âœ… Custom event tag tracking | ğŸ”œ Agent scorecards | | ğŸš§ Javascript/Typescript SDK Alpha | âœ… Session replays | ğŸ”œ Evaluation playground + leaderboard | Debugging Roadmap ğŸ§­ | Performance testing | Environments | LLM Testing | Reasoning and execution testing | | ----------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | | âœ… Event latency analysis | ğŸ”œ Non-stationary environment testing | ğŸ”œ LLM non-deterministic function detection | ğŸš§ Infinite loops and recursive thought detection | | âœ… Agent workflow execution pricing | ğŸ”œ Multi-modal environments | ğŸš§ Token limit overflow flags | ğŸ”œ Faulty reasoning detection | | ğŸš§ Success validators external | ğŸ”œ Execution containers | ğŸ”œ Context limit overflow flags | ğŸ”œ Generative code validators | | ğŸ”œ Agent controllers/skill tests | âœ… Honeypot and prompt injection detection PromptArmor | âœ… API bill tracking | ğŸ”œ Error breakpoint analysis | | ğŸ”œ Information context constraint testing | ğŸ”œ Anti-agent roadblocks i.e. Captchas | ğŸ”œ CI/CD integration checks | | | ğŸ”œ Regression testing | âœ… Multi-agent framework visualization | | | Why AgentOps? ğŸ¤” Without the right tools, AI agents are slow, expensive, and unreliable. Our mission is to bring your agent from prototype to production. Here's why AgentOps stands out: - Comprehensive Observability: Track your AI agents' performance, user interactions, and API usage. - Real-Time Monitoring: Get instant insights with session replays, metrics, and live monitoring tools. - Cost Control: Monitor and manage your spend on LLM and API calls. - Failure Detection: Quickly identify and respond to agent failures and multi-agent interaction issues. - Tool Usage Statistics: Understand how your agents utilize external tools with detailed analytics. - Session-Wide Metrics: Gain a holistic view of your agents' sessions with comprehensive statistics. AgentOps is designed to make agent observability, testing, and monitoring easy.
